NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Danforth location new fave
REVIEWS: Vegan menu is dope. love the sizzling Tofu love the vegan adobo and Garlic rice that dessert is nice too. Did find the afternoon sunday lunch adobo portion to be small however. Shrinkflation perhaps as cost saving? Calamansi Mojito was nice, refreshing even.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Portions too small
REVIEWS: The price is high enough but the portion is unbelievably small and their serving plates are all oversize to give you the impression it's a big order. The taste is questionable of late, maybe new cook?

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: TRY THE DEEP FRIED CHICKEN SKINS
REVIEWS: Saw it on "you gotta eat here" , tried the deep fried chicken skins, amazing with a little salt, very good

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Sour Kare-kare
REVIEWS: The service was slow, it took ages for our food to come. And the Kare-kare they served us taste sour and smells funky I have the feeling it is spoiled coz my wife had diarhea. When we complained about it they said it taste normal...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Very good
REVIEWS: Decor and tropical ambience is attractive. The food is always good. We sometimes come and have dinner as a large family group...this time was no exception. Everyone left, full and happy.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Interesting experience
REVIEWS: It was quite a fun experience with this Philippino restaurant. We ordered the Kamayan Feast and everything was eaten by hand when the whole table was covered by banana leaves as plate. Itâ€™s a good place for fun friends and family gathering.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Quality of Food, Drinks & Service = NOT WORTH THE VALUE!!
REVIEWS: Service is ALWAYS EXTREMELY slow. Need to improve on that. You are in the customer service business and customer service should be your priority. Also, totally overpriced for the brunch combo. French press coffee is overpriced. Get a normally brewed coffee and make it strong....More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: From Boodle to Ala Carte
REVIEWS: Just the right gathering spot for everyone's favourite comfort food with fun-sharing "boodle fight" dishes and Spanish-influenced cuisine as the name of the place suggests.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Disappointed on staff..

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Very friendly owner
REVIEWS: Hosted bday party for my mom, very good food! Owner is very friendly, explain all the food! Over all over good experience!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Awesome food
REVIEWS: everything are great! We enjoy our dinner here, I love their sago at gulaman, the crispy squid it's a Wow! They have boodle fight too(kamayan). The only problem is the parking. But the rest are great.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: So far my best experience of Filipino cuisine

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Service started off cold but progressed to AWESOME

NAME: Casa Manila

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Excellent philipino food
REVIEWS: Really good food, good service as well. We came on a Saturday morning and order the combo dinner. On the expensive side but worth it.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Birthday party
REVIEWS: We recommend reservations. We were there saturday for lunch. They offer a buffet but we decided on ordering off the menu. They have a wide variety of filipino dishes. Good food. Excellent service.

TITLE: WORST SERVICE

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Stop by
REVIEWS: We did a Drive by for halo-halo take-out. Delicious fresh ingredients , perfect balance of sweetness . Friendly staff. Place clean and well presented. Parking is a different story. Very limited parking.

NAME: Casa Manila

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: 80th Birthday Celebration

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Expensive
REVIEWS: Authentic Filipino cuisine, There was confusion with our reservation, rectified very quickly. The good: Authentic Filipino cuisines, fairly tasty, family atmosphere the soup was excellent. The bad: Heavy food, not so good for light night dinner, slow service on Saturday night, expensive

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Amazing Filipino food
REVIEWS: Suggested by a Filipino friend because it was supposed to be the closest real Filipino experience. Was very happy I went and must go back soon to try other dishes!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Great food! Great service!
REVIEWS: My family frequents Casa Manila and always love the ambiance - the food and staff! Thank you for making it the best Filipino Restaurant in Toronto (and Ontario and Canada)!!!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: One of the best Filipino dine-in restaurant in Toronto
REVIEWS: I've been here many many times because we always enjoyed the food and service here, not to mention the restaurant is nicely decorated. I recommend kari kari, pork barbecue, garlic rice, lechon kawali, bulalo (beef soup), vegetable with coconut sauce, sisig and halo halo.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: first Filipino restrauant
REVIEWS: with friends originally from Philippines came here. Very warm and gracious welcome and Service. The food did not disappoint. Enjoyed the fried platter and dessert halo halo. Had the Filipino beer San Miguel-not that good but fun trying it since it was from the Philippines.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Best Philipino Restaurant...as seen on You Gotta Eat Here (Food Network Canada)...

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Filipino food

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Very fatty pork belly
REVIEWS: Nice friendly staff who sadly struggled with English starter an main course came together main course of crispy pork belly was not crispy incredibly fatty and the pork was over cooked. I complained the staff did nothing about it I paid I left

NAME: Casa Manila

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Food of Philipines can be very good.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Authentic Philippine comfort food
REVIEWS: Been wanting to try this restaurant for years and am so glad I finally did. Delicious food, cosy decor and lovely staff. A minor complaint is that my noodle dish did not have enough vegetables and meat in it. Otherwise, absolutely yummy!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: The best in Kamayan or boodle fight servings

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Pretty and interesting food
REVIEWS: Very pretty decor with wonderful service. Doods was wonderful. Quail eggs? How cool. The price was reasonable. The chop sue had really fresh veggies. Calamari was grilled and very tender.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: The real deal

NAME: Casa Manila

TITLE: BIG portions....

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Very fatty pork belly
REVIEWS: Nice friendly staff who sadly struggled with English starter an main course came together main course of crispy pork belly was not crispy incredibly fatty and the pork was over cooked. I complained the staff did nothing about it I paid I left

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Meat anyone?
REVIEWS: If you love meat, look no further! This place has meat, in many different ways: meat on a sizzling platter, meat on a stick (skewer), meat as a chop, meat on banana leaves, meat in a stew, meat in a curry, and lucky us, the...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Food of Philipines can be very good.
REVIEWS: We had a "Winterlicious" lunch. I had the EMBUTIDO TERRINE appetizer, the MANILA CHICKEN CURRY main, and the PURPLE YAM CAKE - UBE CAKE for desert. All were very tasty, well presented, and the Filipino wait staff were very good. The available wines, while limited...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Authentic Philippine comfort food
REVIEWS: Been wanting to try this restaurant for years and am so glad I finally did. Delicious food, cosy decor and lovely staff. A minor complaint is that my noodle dish did not have enough vegetables and meat in it. Otherwise, absolutely yummy!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: The best in Kamayan or boodle fight servings
REVIEWS: If you want to impress your non Filipino friends you got to try having it at Casa Manila at York Mills. Their Kamayan which is basically eating a mixed of dishes served on banana leaves with your bare hands. Their selection of dishes are legit...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Great Filipino Food!
REVIEWS: We have been here a few times for lunch and dinner and the food is always consistently very good. You may want to make reservations on Friday night as we were lucky arriving at 6pm to get the last unreserved table. We had our usual...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Pretty and interesting food
REVIEWS: Very pretty decor with wonderful service. Doods was wonderful. Quail eggs? How cool. The price was reasonable. The chop sue had really fresh veggies. Calamari was grilled and very tender.

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: The real deal
REVIEWS: If you're looking for authentic Filipino food then Casa Manila is the place for you. The friendly staff is so welcoming to newcomers such as myself. The menu has a wide variety of dishes that can cater to all different taste buds. My favourite part...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Beautiful Ambiance, colourful food and bubbly staff

NAME: Casa Manila

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Magandang Pagkain

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Authentic and Tasty

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Great Asian diner!
REVIEWS: Love everything! Try the meat spring rolls, veggie spring rolls, noodles, sour soup, fried rice and crackling fried pork belly . . . to die for! And for sweets, halo-halo!!!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Excellent food and service
REVIEWS: Food is clean an authentic. The service is excellent. It is generally very busy through the weekend The desserts are amazing as well We eat here often

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Very Filipino, so good, so hospitable and friendly!

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Delicious Philippine Food
REVIEWS: With the fine Philippine atmosphere, decor, beautiful collection of paintings by Filipino artists, Casa Manila has changed since the first time I have been there. Food is authentic Philippine dishes and servings are generous. Servers are very attentive, we felt welcomed. The owner, very graciously...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Food not so good!
REVIEWS: The place takes you back to Philippines but the food was a total miss. Before you book a Kamayan make sure you understand the rules. Don't put the deposit in bcoz you will lose it if you cancel. They should include that on their website....More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Best Filipino Cuisine in Toronto
REVIEWS: Casa Manila gives you a sampling of authentic Filipino food. The decor in the restaurant showcases Filipino culture, from bamboo chairs to wood carvings displayed, owner Mila is a former beauty queen (Miss World Philippines 1980) who knows humility and beauty. She shows this off...More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: First Filipino experience, first date, great time
REVIEWS: Choose this place for a first date, great decision. Good and service were amazing. We had to leave at a certain time as there was a private function scheduled, but we had already been there for two hours, and they were very polite about it....More

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: "casa MANILA . will come back to casa MANILA

NAME: Casa Manila
TITLE: Fine Filipino Dining
REVIEWS: Casa Manila showcases the best of Filipino cuisine and mixes it with an ambience that makes you feel like you're in one of Manila's best restaurants.

NAME: Casa Manila

NAME: Casa Manila
